nodes.text: An artillery battalion was a formation of the Imperial Army.

An artillery battalion was comprised of three artillery batteries, an assault company, the battalion headquarters and the necessary vehicles required to transport the artillery. The assault company provided security for the battalion, allowing them to retreat and relocate if necessary. An artillery battalion numbered 810 men, and was equipped with either 48 artillery pieces of the medium or heavy variety, or 96 light artillery emplacements.
Artillery battalions could be augmented by the addition of three more artillery batteries, and an assault company.
